item.title: Oil Listless as Debt Ceiling Remains in Focus
item.description: Oil prices flicked between small gains and losses as investors awaited fresh news on the U.S. debt ceiling standoff.

item.title: Julius Baer Four-Month Figures Miss Views
item.description: Shares in Julius Baer sank in early trading after figures for the first four months came in below expectations, with a net new money of CHF3.5 billion being notably disappointing, analysts said.

item.title: Metals Continue Slide on China Demand Worries
item.description: Base metals and gold prices continued to fall as Western economic woes and slower-than-expected Chinese demand cut consumption.

item.title: Dollar Rises After Fed Remarks Signal Further Rate Rises
item.description: The dollar edged up as remarks from Fed officials Monday suggested not all policymakers think pausing interest-rate rises is possible in June, Commerzbank said, adding that investors are likely to hope for more insight from the Fed minutes.

item.title: Vodafone and Nestlé Created Panels to Avoid 'Greenwashing' Allegations
item.description: Companies have enlisted cross-functional groups to internally review environmental marketing claims amid rising scrutiny.

item.title: July 2028 DSL Seen Offering Limited Relative Value on Dutch Curve
item.description: According to Citi, the Dutch 0.75% July 2028 DSL offers limited relative value on the Dutch bond curve, but looking at the bond cross-market, the spread between the Dutch auction bond and Germany’s 0.25% August 2028 bond is at its cheapest level over a one-year horizon.

item.title: Barratt Developments Chair John Allan to Step Down Early
item.description: Barratt Developments said Caroline Silver will take over as chair of the board earlier than originally planned to prevent allegations against John Allan from becoming disruptive to the company.

item.title: Adani Companies' Shares Rise for Second Straight Day
item.description: Shares of companies in the Adani group rose sharply for a second day on Tuesday, amid buoyant investor sentiment, after a panel appointed by India’s Supreme Court found no evidence of price manipulation as alleged by a short seller earlier this year.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.4% in Likely Technical Correction
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average fell 0.4% to close at 30957.77 in a likely technical correction after the benchmark index ended at a 33-year high on Monday.

item.title: Retirement in Paradise Isn't Without Financial Headaches
item.description: Retiring abroad can complicate your taxes, banking and estate planning.

item.title: Shareholder Activists Drag Companies Into U.S. Culture Wars
item.description: Businesses face proposals on abortion, guns and climate change as groups with various viewpoints strive to get their agendas heard at this year’s annual meetings.

item.title: Retirement in Paradise Isn't Without Financial Headaches
item.description: It is easy to make mistakes in taxes, banking and estate planning when retiring abroad, and they can be costly.

item.title: TikTok sued Montana over the state's new ban of the social-media platform, challenging the law's constitutionality.
item.description: TikTok sued Montana over the state’s new ban of the social-media platform, challenging the law’s constitutionality.

item.title: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq gaining 0.02% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Dow fell 0.4%.
item.description: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq gaining 0.02% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Dow fell 0.4%.

item.title: Applied Materials said it would invest as much as $4 billion in a new California facility to conduct research on tools for making semiconductors.
item.description: Applied Materials said it would invest as much as $4 billion in a new California facility to conduct research on tools for making semiconductors.

item.title: Activist investor TCS Capital has built a stake in Yelp and is calling on the service-recommendation site to explore strategic alternatives, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Activist investor TCS Capital has built a stake in Yelp and is calling on the service-recommendation site to explore strategic alternatives, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Facebook owner Meta Platforms was fined $1.3 billion by European Union regulators for sending user information to the U.S., a record privacy penalty for the bloc.
item.description: Facebook owner Meta Platforms was fined $1.3 billion by European Union regulators for sending user information to the U.S., a record privacy penalty for the bloc.

item.title: Chevron deepened its commitment to oil-and-gas drilling in the U.S., spending $6.3 billion to acquire PDC, a rival with sizable operations in Texas and Colorado.
item.description: Chevron deepened its commitment to oil-and-gas drilling in the U.S., spending $6.3 billion to acquire PDC, a rival with sizable operations in Texas and Colorado.

item.title: Share prices for some of the largest office landlords have dropped to near historic lows, reflecting a sluggish return-to-office rate and a rise in the number of short sellers.
item.description: Share prices for some of the largest office landlords have dropped to near historic lows, reflecting a sluggish return-to-office rate and a rise in the number of short sellers.

item.title: U.S. and NATO leaders are coalescing around a vision for shoring up Ukrainian defenses and seeking to guarantee the country's sovereign future as Kyiv enters a pivotal stage in its war with Russia.
item.description: U.S. and NATO leaders are coalescing around a vision for shoring up Ukrainian defenses and seeking to guarantee the country’s sovereign future as Kyiv enters a pivotal stage in its war with Russia.
